chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: The goal of this document is to provide a short guide for starting development for the CodeX platform: architecture, development environment setup, directory structure and programming tips and conventions.

No, this guide does not present all the mechanisms and functions available to the CodeX programmer: it is only a startup guide that will help write the first scripts. Then, there is a lot more to learn by looking at the existing code!

section.title: Skill Requirements
section.para: Even though programming for the CodeX platform does not require very advanced skills, existing knowledge in a few technologies will greatly help. More precisely, here are the initial skills that are the most useful:

listitem.para: PHP Almost all CodeX source code is written in PHP. Note that, starting from version 2.2, only PHP4 will be supported.

MySQL and more generally SQL language is used very often when programming for CodeX. With PHP, there is no state saved between successive calls, so all needed data is read from a mySQL database each time a script is executed.
Web application programming: for instance, CGI programming, GET/POST mechanisms, cookies, Apache server, and also rendering languages like HTML, CSS, or Javascript in some cases.
Script programming: CodeX strongly rely on system tools, so some knowledge is required in Shell programming, Perl, Python, and Linux administration.

section.title: Programmer References
section.para: Here is a list of useful resources freely available to the programmer:

listitem.para: PHP Manual, available at http://www.php.net/manual/en/: this is an invaluable resource for PHP programmers: function references, comprehensive search and user examples.
MySQL Reference Manual, available at http://dev.mysql.com/doc/mysql/en/index.html: reference manual with SQL syntax, examples and user comments.

CodeX Installation Guide: this guide gives an overview of the system aspects of CodeX: user accounts, file system, RPM packages, SSH, cron jobs, as well as information on CodeX customization: UI themes, site content.

CodeX Administration Guide: this guide details administration tasks, file structure, and tools configuration (MySQL, Apache, CVS, etc.). It is a reference document when it comes to modifying any administrative script.
